column5: Re: Wax worms - The answer on here (WC) sometime ago was that wax worms were not allowed to be brought in. Bill

What live baits and the quanity can be brought into Canada? From some of the postings it sounds like you can only bring in crawlers, is this correct? Also any information About Praire Bee Lakes would be greatly appreciated.Thanks Vandy

Here is what is written in the regs, Import of Bait It is illegal to bring live fish, crayfish or salamanders intoOntario for use as bait. It is illegal to bring live leeches into Ontario for use as bait,unless you are the holder of a commercial bait licence.There is no restriction on the amount of crawlers you can bring in.
Make sure those crawlers are in bedding not dirt.
Thank you for the information, would have never thought about bedding verses dirt. Excellent point. Thanks again

You are correct about the worms not being in dirt and they should be in commercial bedding. What I have never been able to find in the regulations is anything about wax worms. Does anyone have any information on transporting wax worms into Canada??
What about the big thing of crawlers you can buy from Cabelas? Sealed and the whole deal!
You should check with Cabelas but I think they are in bedding and probably came from Canada anyway.
Are salted minnows allowed to be brought into Canada for fishing?
Yes they are and for us they have been very effective, Easier to fish than live ones and stay on the hook much better.

It depends where in Canada. In Quebec you can not bring them in from the states. Importation of bait-fishThe importation of bait-fish, dead or alive, is prohibited. http://www.mrn.gouv.qc.ca/english/pu.../bait-fish.aspThe past few years, salted dead bait fish was prohibited, best check the rules for the zone you plan to fish.
